security_audit.summary: Legitimate web search skill that executes the gemini CLI command with user queries. Static findings are false positives: the 'backtick execution' patterns are markdown code formatting, the 'weak cryptographic algorithm' alerts are metadata/report fields, and 'high entropy' detections are standard shell script and search query content. The skill behaves exactly as documented with no suspicious behavior.

content.user_title: Search the web with gemini command
content.value_statement: Default web search tools may lack depth for complex research. This skill uses the gemini command to perform advanced searches that deliver detailed, sourced answers to nuanced questions.
actual_capabilities: Executes web searches using the gemini CLI command
Handles complex research queries with detailed results
Returns answers in Markdown format with source URLs
Supports natural language search queries in multiple languages
Integrates multiple search results into cohesive answers
limitations: Requires the gemini CLI tool to be installed and configured
External gemini service handles actual search execution
Results depend on gemini service availability and response quality

use_cases.title: Research technical topics
use_cases.description: Find documentation, release notes, and solutions for programming questions

use_cases.title: Gather accurate information
use_cases.description: Collect sourced details for creating accurate documentation and guides

use_cases.title: Conduct deep research
use_cases.description: Investigate complex topics with comprehensive search and synthesis

prompt_templates.title: Basic Search
prompt_templates.prompt: bash scripts/web-search.sh "What is the latest version of React?"

prompt_templates.title: Technical Research
prompt_templates.prompt: bash scripts/web-search.sh "Explain Next.js 15 features with examples from official docs"

prompt_templates.title: Comparison Query
prompt_templates.prompt: bash scripts/web-search.sh "Compare Vite and Webpack with pros and cons"

prompt_templates.title: Troubleshooting Search
prompt_templates.prompt: bash scripts/web-search.sh "Fix TypeScript error: type string is not assignable to type number"

output_examples.input: bash scripts/web-search.sh "What are the key features of Next.js 15?"
output: - **Server Actions stabilization** - Enhanced data mutation patterns
- **Turbopack improvements** - Faster builds with better caching
- **Partial Prerendering** - Hybrid static and dynamic rendering

output_examples.input: bash scripts/web-search.sh "Compare React Query and Redux for state management"
output: React Query and Redux serve different purposes:
- **React Query** - Server state management, caching, synchronization
- **Redux** - Client state management, predictable state container
Use React Query for API data. Use Redux for complex client state.

output_examples.input: bash scripts/web-search.sh "How to fix TypeScript type assignment error"
output: - **Type widening** - Use const assertions or explicit types
Example fix: Use `as const` or type annotations

best_practices: Use specific, detailed queries for better results
Include information source preferences in your query
Request specific output formats when needed
anti_patterns: Expecting real-time data without specifying time range

faq.question: What tools does this skill integrate with?
faq.answer: This skill requires the gemini CLI tool. It works with Claude Code and related AI assistants.

faq.question: How many search results are returned?
faq.answer: The gemini command determines result count. Complex queries return comprehensive results with multiple sources.

faq.question: Can I use this alongside other search tools?
faq.answer: Yes. Use this skill when you need detailed research. Default search works for quick lookups.

faq.question: Is my search data sent to third parties?
faq.answer: Queries are sent to the gemini service. Review gemini CLI documentation for privacy details.

faq.question: Why are results sometimes delayed?
faq.answer: Response time depends on gemini service. Complex queries require more processing time.

faq.question: How is this different from default web search?
faq.answer: This skill uses gemini for synthesis and formatting. Default search returns raw results faster.
